Bandit: BasicGaussianBandit

Source: R/bandit_basic_gaussian.R
BasicGaussianBandit.Rd

Context-free Gaussian multi-armed bandit.

Details

Simulates k Gaussian arms where each arm models the reward as a normal distribution with provided mean mu and standard deviation sigma.

Usage

  policy <- BasicGaussianBandit$new(mu_per_arm, sigma_per_arm)

Arguments

mu_per_arm

numeric vector; mean mu for each of the bandit's k arms

sigma_per_arm

numeric vector; standard deviation sigma for each of the bandit's k arms

Methods

new(mu_per_arm, sigma_per_arm)

generates and instantializes a new Bandit instance. For arguments, see Argument section above.

get_context(t)

argument:

  • t: integer, time step t.

returns a named list containing the number of arms as context$k.

get_reward(t, context, action)

arguments:

  • t: integer, time step t.

  • context: list, with context$k (number of arms).

  • action: list, containing action$choice (as set by policy).

returns a named list containing reward$reward

See also

Core contextual classes: Bandit, Policy, Simulator, Agent, History, Plot

Bandit subclass examples: BasicGaussianBandit, ContextualLogitBandit, LiSamplingOfflineBandit

Policy subclass examples: EpsilonGreedyPolicy, ContextualThompsonSamplingPolicy

Examples


horizon            <- 100
sims               <- 100

policy             <- EpsilonGreedyPolicy$new(epsilon = 0.1)

bandit             <- BasicGaussianBandit$new(c(0,0,1), c(1,1,1))
agent              <- Agent$new(policy,bandit)

history            <- Simulator$new(agent, horizon, sims)$run()
#> Cloning, precaching and precalculating bandits and policies
#> Preworkercreation
#> Cores available: 4
#> Workers assigned: 3
#> Postworkercreation

plot(history, type = "cumulative", regret = TRUE)
